H0.text: Twice as high as the first sample's temperature is the temperature at which Joyce's second, 400‑milliliter water sample started to boil, given that the first 200‑milliliter sample boiled at 100 °C.

H1.text: Slightly higher than the first sample's temperature is the temperature when Joyce’s second sample of 400 milliliters of water started to boil.

H2.text: Half as high as the first sample's is the temperature when Joyce’s 400‑milliliter sample started to boil, after she recorded 100 °C for the 200‑milliliter sample.

H3.text: The temperature when the second sample started to boil is the same as the first sample's, 100 °C, because the boiling point of water at the same conditions is independent of the volume.
